content.description: The following table shows summary statistics for the number of hours a group of students spent playing video games last Monday and last Saturday.
content.question: Day Minimum <math alttext="Q 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="bold"><mrow><mtext>Q1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Median <math alttext="Q 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="bold"><mrow><mtext mathvariant="bold">Q3</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> â€‹Maximum Monday 0 1 2 4 12 Saturday 1 4 6 8 18 Based on the summary statistics, which of the following gives the best comparison of the range and the interquartile range <math alttext="I Q R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>(IQR)</mtext></mrow></math> of the two days?

choices.label: The range and <math alttext="I Q R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>IQR</mtext></mrow></math> of hours played on Monday are both greater than the range and <math alttext="I Q R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IQR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of hours played on Saturday.

The range and <math alttext="I Q R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IQR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of hours played on Monday are both less than the range and <math alttext="I Q R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IQR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of hours played on Saturday.

The range and <math alttext="I Q R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IQR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of hours played on Monday are both equal to the range and <math alttext="I Q R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IQR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of hours played on Saturday.

The range of hours played on Monday is greater than the range of hours played on Saturday, and the <math alttext="I Q R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IQR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of hours played on Monday is less than the <math alttext="I Q R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IQR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of hours played on Saturday.

The range of hours played on Monday is less than the range of hours played on Saturday, and the <math alttext="I Q R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IQR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of hours played on Monday is greater than the <math alttext="I Q R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IQR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of hours played on Saturday.

content.answer: The range and <math alttext="I Q R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IQR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of hours played on Monday are both less than the range and <math alttext="I Q R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IQR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of hours played on Saturday.

topic.text: 1.9: Comparing Distributions of a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Compare distributions or relative positions of points within a distribution.
